handNote.p: The hand has undergone a slight narrowing at f. 92r and has made some adjustments in some letterforms, but is likely the same hand as before (see Ker's Catalogue of MSS Containing AS). A round Anglo-Saxon hybrid miniscule: caroline a, caroline g, with a mix of caroline and insular long s. Caroline g's tail no longer has the earlier flourish to the left. Caroline long s frequently descends well below the line. f is descending and both crossing stroke and top stroke formed with a downward hook. Rounded d, now usually with shorter ascender than prior to the shift, and eth still with long ascender curving back to the right. Pronounced wedges on ascenders, leaning almost to forking, and similarly emphatic serifs on the feet of minims. Overall slight lean to the right.

An Anglo-Saxon miniscule emending hand using a rather widely-cut pen squeezes in some alternative readings and additions in margins and interlinearly, of note 'achen' and 'achenne' for reflexive 'sylfes'. The emending hand, rather squat and uncalligraphic, uses rounded d, caroline long descending s, and other otherwise similar letterforms as the main scribe, though a flat-topped g appears in a marginal addition on on f. 119v.
